member.name: M:MacPharma.DatabaseOperations.#ctor
member.summary: Default our connection to a database in the executable folder

member.name: M:MacPharma.DatabaseOperations.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Use a different database then the one in the executable folder. When using this the database must have the same table and fields.

member.name: M:MacPharma.DatabaseOperations.LoadCustomers
member.summary: Read USA customers from database into a DataTable
member.remarks: Database is assumed to be in the Bin\Debug folder.

member.name: M:MacPharma.DatabaseOperations.LoadContactTitles
member.summary: Load a list of contact titles.
member.remarks: In a well normalized database we would have a contact tile table and the customer table would have a integer field that would join to the contact title table.

member.name: M:MacPharma.DatabaseOperations.RemoveCurrentCustomer(System.Int32)
member.summary: Remove a customer by primary key

member.name: M:MacPharma.DatabaseOperations.AddNewRow(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Add a new customer to the database table

member.name: M:MacPharma.DatabaseOperations.UpdateRow(System.Data.DataRow)
member.summary: Update a row
member.remarks: I used Parameters.Add instead of Parameters.AddWithValue where Parameters.AddWithValue is usually best yet wanted to show Parameters.Add as many don't realize this is a viable way to add parameters and really shines when doing multiple adds or updates in say a for-each or for-next.
